title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Mostly Flat as Solana Price Sags 5%
description: Things for Solana have been more of a mixed bag. SOL has dipped, but the network's DeFi ecosystem surpassed $2B for the first time since 2022.

title: Bitcoin futures open interest near ‘alarm raising’ $24B level — Are bulls at risk?
description:
BTC futures open interest approaches a record high and today’s sharp sell-off triggered alarm from traders.

Bitcoin (BTC) took a shot at $53,000 on Feb. 20, briefly surpassing $52,900 before correcting as the result of $50 million in leveraged long liquidations. Nevertheless, even with a drop to $50,750, Bitcoin futures open interest remains at $23.7 billion, which is just 2.5% below its all-time high in April 2021.

In April 2021, the open interest figure peaked at $24.3 billion but failed to break the $64,900 resistance, leading to a 27% correction in 11 days. With the current strong demand for BTC futures contracts, investors are contemplating the possibility of a similar outcome.

Some traders argue that the rise in Bitcoin futures open interest indicates excessive borrowing, but this is not universally accurate. Every derivatives trade requires a buyer and a seller of the same size and an investor may be fully hedged even when utilizing leverage, such as buying monthly BTC futures and simultaneously selling an equivalent amount of perpetual contracts if a favorable price difference exists.

Read more

title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
description:
Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

Pro-crypto attorney John Deaton launched his Senate campaign to unseat Elizabeth Warren but didn't mention digital assets in his announcement. Meanwhile, Coinbase’s Bitcoin (BTC) holdings have fallen to their lowest level in nearly a decade, and BlackRock's latest spot Bitcoin ETF ad has labeled Bitcoin as “progress.”

Attorney and pro-crypto advocate John Deaton has kicked off his Senate race to unseed Elizabeth Warren—but oddly didn’t mention crypto or digital assets during his campaign launch.

In a Feb. 20 video released on X, Deaton said his campaign would focus on “taking on the Washington elites,” adding that Senator Warren “gets nothing done” for the state of Massachusetts.

Read more

title: Hong Kong issues regulatory standards for tokenized financial products
description:
The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) unveiled comprehensive regulatory standards on Feb. 20 for the sale and distribution of tokenized financial products by authorized institutions. The initiative aims to foster innovation while ensuring robust consumer protection within the burgeoning field of tokenization, where real-world assets (RWA) are digitally represented using distributed ledger technology or similar […]

The post Hong Kong issues regulatory standards for tokenized financial products appeared first on CryptoSlate.

title: The surprising surge of crypto in Russia – What’s driving it?
description: Cryptocurrency usage is reportedly on the rise in Russia, with a significant uptick in the number of citizens engaging in Bitcoin and other digital token transactions. title: Ethereum price hits $3k, outperforms Bitcoin despite $36b ETF inflows
description: Ethereum on-chain data shows how investors depositing $1.5 billion into staking contracts could further propel ETH price ahead of Bitcoin.

title: IOTA Joins Forces in Consortium to Tackle Crypto AML Regulations
description: The last year 2023 witnessed a massive crackdown on the crypto sector in the wake of violating the AML rules. In Feb 2024, IDnow joined a consortium with IOTA Foundation, walt.id, SPYCE.5, and Bloom Labs to ensure CASPs and self-hosted wallets comply with EU regulations. title: New Crypto Valued $0.0012 to Capture Shiba Inu (SHIB) Market Cap
